passages.text: Downgrade to Sell on subdued steel industry capex, not offset by new initiatives
600845. SS 12m Price Target: Rmb15.40 Price: Rmb25.63 Downside: \(39.9\%\)

We downgrade Baosight to Sell from Neutral with an updated TP of Rmb15.4, implying \(39\%\) downside. With steel industry capex growth deteriorating to \(- 4\%\) yoy in 1- 7M2025 (vs. \(- 1\%\) yoy in 1- 6M25 and \(+2\%\) yoy in full- year 2024), our GS China Basic Materials team sees persistent oversupply and depressed profitability in the Chinese steel sector, given the stagnant demand while supply exit remains absent; they expect capacity addition to remain muted, with total capacity to be maintained at 1.4bn tonnes in 2025E- 27E (see also: China in Transition China's capacity - The delayed inflection). Related party (RP) revenue within Baowu Group, Baosight's parent company, was down \(26\%\) yoy in 1H25 (vs. \(- 14\% / - 9\%\) yoy in 1H24/2H24) and was the key driver of the 2Q25 results miss (see also: Baosight: 2Q25 miss on prolonged steel capex weakness), and we believe the RP revenue weakness will sustain, based on our Basic Materials team forecasts of \(- 16\% /0\%\) capex growth for Baosteel (600019. SS) in 2026E/27E (report link). Meanwhile, the new initiatives in which Baosight has been investing, e.g. industrial robots, large PLC (programmable logic controller), and industrial software/AI, are still too small in scale to offset the steel end- market weakness (c. \(60\%\) of Baosight's total sales in 2024 per GSe), with the industrial robot subsidiary only contributing \(3\% /1\%\) of total sales/earnings in 1H25.

Earnings, TP, and rating revisions: We revise down our 2025E- 30E net income forecasts by \(23\%\) on average to (1) reflect the subdued domestic steel industry capex; (2) higher SG&A ratio as \(0\%\) sales as the company continues to make investment in new initiatives, which we do not expect can offset the steel end- market weakness in the near term. Our updated TP of Rmb15.4 (down from Rmb21.50) is based on 2026E P/E of 25x (vs. previously based on 2026E P/E of 27x), considering (1) our lowered long- term earnings

CAGR of \(13\%\) (vs. previous estimate of \(16\%\) ) and lowered ROE forecasts of \(19\%\) in 2027- 30E on average (vs. previous estimates of \(24\%\) ); (2) \(25x\) is in line with 1 S.D. below historical average forward \(E / E\) of \(33x\) , reflecting the current steel industry capex downturn, but still above historical trough valuation of \(18x\) given that we project normalized earnings growth after 2026E; (3) similar but slightly lower than average P/E of \(27x\) in 2016- 19, when the steel industry was hit by a major policy overhang (similar to the recent "Anti- inquisition" campaign), i.e. cutting domestic steel production capacity as part of supply-side reform announced by the Chinese central government in Feb 2016, while on the other hand, during that period, Baosight benefited from new projects associated with a series of M&A deals made by its parent company Baosteel, but the M&A pace in recent years seems to be slowing down; and (4) correlation of target price implied P/E vs. growth profile for our China Industrial Tech coverage stocks. As such we downgrade the stock to Sell from Neutral on \(39\%\) downside (vs. China Industrial Tech coverage average of \(- 14\%\) downside). Our 2025- 27E sales/net income estimates are \(19\% /35\%\) below Wind Consensus as we believe the market has not fully factored in the prolonged steel capex downturn.

Faster expansion into ex- steel markets: We estimate that ex- steel business accounted for \(\sim 27\%\) of total revenue in 2024. Going forward, if Baosight achieves faster- than- expected expansion into ex- steel markets, such as railway, pharmaceuticals, non- ferrous metals, and chemicals, our ex- steel revenue forecasts could be more positive.

- Faster industry consolidation progress of Baowu Group: We believe Baowu's consolidation efforts will bring upgrade demand and M&A opportunities for Baosight. If the consolidation progress is faster than expected going forward, our revenue and net income forecasts could be positively impacted.- Faster commercialization of new products: Baosight has seen some adoptions of industrial internet platforms and in-house PLC products by customers, but we believe the revenue contribution is small currently. Going forward, if the commercialization progress of these new products is faster than expected, our revenue and margin forecasts could be positively impacted.
The author would like to thank Zhou Li, Hao Chen, Zhihan Ye, and Junfang Zhang for their contributions to this report.
Valuation: Our 12- m TP of Rmb15.4 is based on 25x 2026E P/E.

Investment thesis: Baosight is a leading production software provider in China, especially in Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), and the largest informatization & automation enabler for the steel industry, thanks to its parent company, Baowu Steel Group – the largest steel producer in China by crude steel production. We look for Baosight to grow its business on (1) increased spending on production software to improve industrial manufacturing process efficiency; (2) Baowu's continued consolidation in the steel industry; and (3) Baosight's proven track record of expanding into new customers and new markets. That said, we estimate that c.60% of Baosight's revenue in 2024 was exposed to the domestic steel end- market, making it vulnerable to the current steel industry production control and capex contraction trend. Meanwhile, with 51% of Baosight's revenue (in 2024) from related- party transactions with its parent, we believe Baosight is subject to spending fluctuations from this major customer. Our 2025- 27E net income estimates are on average 35% below Wind Consensus. We consider its valuation as unattractive vs. our China Industrial Tech coverage on a P/E basis and are Sell rated. Upside risks: (1) faster expansion into ex- steel markets; (2) faster industry consolidation progress of Baowu Group; (3) faster commercialization of new products.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.
